examples: Intellectually, this man and I are worlds apart.
Her children mean the world to her.
The department led the world in cancer research.
The novel is worlds apart from his academic writings.
She had broken the world 100 meters record.
words.defineEn: the planet Earth, where we all live
words.defineVi: hành tinh Trái đất, nơi tất cả chúng ta sống

examples: An environment that widens my mind.
Everyone should do their bit for the environment.
Not following safety guidelines is unacceptable in hazardous environments.
The company culture was toxic, with a cutthroat environment and a focus on profits at all costs.
They were completely at one with their environment.
words.defineEn: the natural world around us where people, animals, and plants live
words.defineVi: thế giới tự nhiên xung quanh chúng ta, nơi con người, động vật và thực vật sinh sống

examples: My mom planted beautiful flowers in the front yard.
The child carefully planted caryopses of wildflowers in the garden.
He planted a gentle kiss on her cheek.
They have planted the seeds of their own destruction.
He planted arrowroot in his backyard garden.
words.defineEn: a living thing that grows in ground or water; usually having leaves, stems, flowers, etc.
words.defineVi: một sinh vật mọc trong đất hoặc nước; thường có lá, thân, hoa, v.v.

examples: More conservative candidates are losing ground in key battleground states.
As a health-conscious individual, he sprinkled ground flaxseed over his morning yogurt.
The company is gaining ground rapidly with its new product launch.
Her skirt almost reached the ground.
The grounds covered eight acres.
words.defineEn: the surface layer of Earth that is solid and people walk on
words.defineVi: lớp bề mặt của Trái đất rắn chắc và mọi người đi bộ trên

examples: After all, fields have eyes, and woods have ears.
They turned the horse into the field.
To drive sheep into a field.
The majestic horse galloped across the open field.
The baseball team has nine players on the field at a time.
words.defineEn: a piece of land in the country, especially one where crops are grown or animals are kept, typically surrounded by a fence, etc.
words.defineVi: một mảnh đất trong nước, đặc biệt là nơi trồng trọt hoặc chăn nuôi, thường được bao quanh bởi một hàng rào, v.v.

examples: Asian landscapes range from breathtaking mountains to stunning beaches.
The old painting depicted a picturesque landscape from a bygone era.
The snowy landscape looked magical under the moonlight.
The full moon cast a soft glow on the landscape.
The African landscape is diverse, ranging from lush rainforests to vast deserts.
words.defineEn: a beautiful scene in the countryside that can be seen in one particular view
words.defineVi: một cảnh đẹp ở vùng nông thôn có thể được nhìn thấy trong một góc nhìn cụ thể

examples: They exchanged views on every subject under the sun.
He holds strange views on education.
The course gives you a bird's eye view of European art history.
He takes the view that children are responsible for their own actions.
Being assigned to the General Secretariat provided a worm's-eye view of international diplomacy.
words.defineEn: a place or an area that can be seen, and is usually beautiful
words.defineVi: một nơi hoặc một khu vực có thể được nhìn thấy, và thường là đẹp

examples: The sunny weather melted the snow, revealing patches of green grass.
Don't let the grass grow under your feet, kid.
I need to cut the grass in the backyard with a lawnmower.
She learned the hard way that the grass is always greener on the other side.
I saw a lion hunting for prey in the tall grass.
words.defineEn: a plant with thin, short, and green upright leaves, commonly found in gardens, parks, etc.
words.defineVi: một loại cây có lá thẳng đứng mỏng, ngắn và xanh, thường thấy trong vườn, công viên, v.v.

examples: The coast is clear.
New York City is located on the east coast of the United States.
My brother went to see if the coast was clear, and we snuck out of our bedroom.
because by the middle of summer, the coast becomes home to big swarms of mosquitos and other biting insects!
The southern coast of the United States has a variety of different accents.
words.defineEn: the land near or next to a sea or ocean
words.defineVi: vùng đất gần hoặc bên cạnh biển hoặc đại dương

examples: A path led down the hill.
The village was set among olive groves on a hill.
They were driven to an unknown place in the hills.
The truck's engine roared as it climbed the steep hill.
An engineer suggested driving a tunnel through the Judean hills.
words.defineEn: a naturally raised area of land that is higher than the land around it, but smaller than a mountain
words.defineVi: một vùng đất được nâng lên tự nhiên cao hơn vùng đất xung quanh nó, nhưng nhỏ hơn một ngọn núi

examples: He now rocks a distinguished look with his silver strands.
Charity hits rock bottom in Emmerdale.
He's got rocks in his head.
Morale within the company was at rock bottom.
The boat rocked gently as we set sail on a sunny day.
words.defineEn: a piece of rock, standing or projecting above the earth's surface or in the sea
words.defineVi: một mảnh đá, đứng hoặc nhô lên trên bề mặt trái đất hoặc trên biển

examples: In front of them the valley dropped sharply away from the road.
The land dropped steeply away into a small valley.
The river flows through the valley, creating a beautiful landscape.
The mountain provided a natural barrier between the two valleys.
The river took a meandering bend through the picturesque valley.
words.defineEn: a low area of land between mountains or hills, often with a river flowing through it
words.defineVi: một vùng đất thấp giữa núi hoặc đồi, thường có một dòng sông chảy qua nó

examples: The road led away from the house directly to the lake.
Sunlight played on the surface of the lake.
We enjoyed a picnic by the lake, and she surprised us with a brooklime-infused lemonade.
We saw a beautiful white swan swimming in the lake.
During the heatwave, the group of friends decided to cool off by skinny-dipping in the lake, enjoying the refreshing water in their birthday suits under the moonlight.
words.defineEn: a large area of water, surrounded by land
words.defineVi: một khu vực rộng lớn của nước, bao quanh bởi đất

examples: Ancient historians wrote of a lost continent beneath the ocean.
Such helps were like drop in the ocean.
The ocean's blue color amazed us.
We have sounded the depths of the ocean.
The ship sailed across the ocean, carrying cargo from one country to another.
words.defineEn: the great mass of salt water that covers most of the Earth’s surface
words.defineVi: khối lượng lớn nước muối bao phủ hầu hết bề mặt Trái đất

examples: He discovered a new variety of legume while exploring the rainforest.
The explorer's epic journey through the Amazon rainforest lasted for months and covered thousands of miles.
The African landscape is diverse, ranging from lush rainforests to vast deserts.
And sure enough, rainforests get more rain than any other place on Earth.
Other biomes include tropical rainforest, tundra, deserts, and oceans.
words.defineEn: ‌a thick, tropical forest with tall trees and consistently heavy rainfall
words.defineVi: ‌một khu rừng nhiệt đới rậm rạp với những cây cao và lượng mưa lớn liên tục

examples: Hunger drives the wolf out of the wood.
The wood is held in position by a clamp.
The track led us through a wood.
The coffee table was a dark wood color.
You're not seeing the woods for trees.
words.defineEn: the hard material that the trunk and branches of a tree or shrub are made of, used for fuel or timber
words.defineVi: vật liệu cứng mà thân và cành của cây hoặc bụi cây được làm bằng, được sử dụng làm nhiên liệu hoặc gỗ

examples: Government investment has brought thousands of new jobs to the area.
We have a cozy sitting area downstairs by the fireplace.
Rural areas have been worst hit by the strike.
The twentieth century saw dramatic changes in most areas of life.
Over the years, the company has broken fresh ground in many different areas, from technology to healthcare.
words.defineEn: a particular part or region of a city, country, or the world
words.defineVi: một phần hoặc khu vực cụ thể của một thành phố, quốc gia hoặc thế giới

examples: A path led down the hill.
A path that beats swords into plowshares.
She will follow a different path than her siblings.
They have followed a different path in their personal lives.
John will follow the path of least resistance.
words.defineEn: a way or track that is built or is made by people walking over the same ground
words.defineVi: một con đường hoặc con đường được xây dựng hoặc được thực hiện bởi những người đi bộ trên cùng một mặt đất

examples: The custard apple's natural sweetness makes it a perfect filling for homemade pies and tarts.
The mountain provided a natural barrier between the two valleys.
The natural tanginess of tamarind adds a unique twist to sauces, marinades, and soups.
He used turnip leaves as natural wrapping for steamed dumplings.
We used honey as a natural sweetener in our homemade salad dressing.
words.defineEn: found in, coming from or agreeing with nature
words.defineVi: tìm thấy trong, đến từ hoặc phù hợp với tự nhiên

examples: After all, one case of the trots hardly spells disaster.
The current situation is spelling disaster for the project.
For Walter, disaster followed hard on the heels of his initial success.
This disaster comes hard on the heels of last week’s train crash.
Mary's idea of a holiday with her in-laws has disaster written all over it!
words.defineEn: a sudden and unfortunate event that causes a great amount of damage, death and destruction
words.defineVi: một sự kiện bất ngờ và không may gây ra một lượng lớn thiệt hại, cái chết và sự hủy diệt

examples: Four people were killed when a train plunged into a flooded river.
The inexperienced DIY enthusiast tried to fix a complex plumbing problem, and caused a flood in the house.
The rising flood waters had driven her out of the village.
British retailers are flooding the U.S. fashion market.
Now, the tsunami flooded the nuclear plant.
words.defineEn: the rising of a body of water taking dry places and causing damages
words.defineVi: sự dâng lên của một vùng nước chiếm những nơi khô ráo và gây ra thiệt hại

examples: The country was hit by a major earthquake.
The volunteers who helped rebuild the school after the earthquake are making a world of difference in the lives of the students and their families.
Earthquakes happen when the water rocks back and forth.
On the other hand, the earthquake created a massive demand for cars.
So the earthquake was roughly over here.
words.defineEn: the sudden movement and shaking of the Earth's surface, usually causing damage
words.defineVi: sự chuyển động và rung chuyển đột ngột của bề mặt Trái đất, thường gây ra thiệt hại

examples: The homeowner didn't listen to the advice of experts to reinforce his house before the hurricane hit.
The devastation caused by the hurricane was for words.
Hurricanes bring high winds and treacherous rainfall.
And of course, hurricanes impact land animals, too.
This feedback loop turns hurricanes into self-sufficient engines of destruction.
words.defineEn: a very strong and destructive wind that moves in circles, often seen in the Caribbean
words.defineVi: một cơn gió rất mạnh và có sức tàn phá di chuyển theo vòng tròn, thường thấy ở vùng biển Caribe

examples: The idea hit me like a tornado.
The sirens sounded, warning of a tornado.
Tornadoes begin with a thunderstorm but not just any thunderstorm.
We had a tornado.
One tornado struck just after midnight in the city of Newnan, some 40 miles southwest of Atlanta.
words.defineEn: a strong and dangerous type of wind, which is formed like a turning cone, usually causing damage
words.defineVi: một loại gió mạnh và nguy hiểm, được hình thành giống như một hình nón quay, thường gây ra thiệt hại

examples: The bad weather brought famine.
Famine followed in the wake of the drought.
Whatever meager rations remained were sent to the troops fighting the war, so the civilian population faced the brunt of the famine.
Famines don't just happen naturally.
For the most part, famines have historically been man-made disasters.
words.defineEn: a situation where there is not enough food that causes hunger and death
words.defineVi: một tình huống không có đủ thức ăn gây ra đói và chết

examples: But a storm or avalanche changes the landscape in the blink of an eye.
And it's like an avalanche.
Avalanche airbags inflate around a person tumbling and being buried by snow.
So an avalanche of nanoflares might generate enough energy to heat the atmosphere to the temperatures we measure.
This creates an avalanche effect, as each high-speed electron knocks out even more electrons and they all shoot through the cloud.
words.defineEn: large amounts of snow falling from mountains
words.defineVi: một lượng lớn tuyết rơi từ trên núi

examples: Famine followed in the wake of the drought.
The entire region has been in the grip of a terrible drought.
One of the worst droughts in living memory scourged large parts of Africa, including Mozambique.
She was extremely sick, but we were waiting for a raindrop in the drought.
For many people, finding a job these days is like waiting for a raindrop in the drought.
words.defineEn: a long period of time when there is not much raining
words.defineVi: một thời gian dài khi không có nhiều mưa

examples: We had a very interesting discussion about climate change.
The previous administration kicked the can down the road on climate change, and now we're facing the consequences.
I would like to raise an alarm bell today because of the fight against climate change.
The actor has become the poster boy for environmental activism, using his celebrity status to raise awareness about climate change.
We need to take action to address climate change.
words.defineEn: a permanent change in global or regional climate patterns, including temperature, wind, and rainfall
words.defineVi: một sự thay đổi vĩnh viễn trong các kiểu khí hậu toàn cầu hoặc khu vực, bao gồm nhiệt độ, gió và lượng mưa

examples: Accidents like this happen all the time.
The most recent incident happened only a week ago.
The same thing happened to me.
Change doesn't happen overnight.
The door happened to be unlocked.
words.defineEn: to take place, particularly with no plan
words.defineVi: diễn ra, đặc biệt là không có kế hoạch

examples: The team took a terrible beating.
You've made a terrible mess of this job.
I had terrible butterflies before I gave that talk in Venice.
The situation was terrible, but like many politicians he was attracted by troubled waters.
The entire region has been in the grip of a terrible drought.
words.defineEn: very serious; causing harm or damage
words.defineVi: rất nghiêm trọng; gây hại hoặc thiệt hại

examples: Northeast of here, that same uplift created the Rocky Mountains, and their snow-covered peaks.
The car sells especially well in the Northeast.
Will the Northeast get less snow?
In November, two monster storms slammed into Nicaragua’s northeast coast.
Almost 2,000 refugees have already left northeast Syria in the last week.
words.defineEn: the direction midway between north and east
words.defineVi: hướng nằm giữa bắc và đông

examples: In the northwest, a hundred percent customer satisfaction was required.
And the same thing is happening across the Northwest.
Normally, potato production across the Northwest looks like this.
Have you ever seen the movie North by Northwest?
Idlib Province, in the northwest corner of Syria, is home to one of the biggest displacement crises in the world.
words.defineEn: the direction midway between north and west
words.defineVi: hướng nằm giữa bắc và tây

examples: 3,000 to 5,000 students andcitizens left the square by the southeast corner.
The quake hit Tuesday afternoon near the Puebla state town of Raboso, 76 miles southeast of Mexico City.
There was an earthquake in Croatia, a little bit southeast of Zagreb.
The temple’s only entrance lies at the very southeast corner.
Staples like rice are grown in southeast Asia, maize and cassava in South America, and sorghum in Africa.
words.defineEn: the direction midway between south and east
words.defineVi: hướng giữa nam và đông

examples: Southwest only flies Boeing 737's.

The shutdown has devastated small business owners throughout southwest Georgia.
The underground Fordow site is located about 55 miles southwest of Tehran.
But Southwest still posted a profit of $741 million.
words.defineEn: the direction midway between south and west
words.defineVi: hướng giữa nam và tây

examples: Offenders should receive their just deserts.
The west is home to vast deserts, rolling plains, and majestic mountain ranges.
The incident showed that desert and reward seldom keep company.
The Earth has diverse ecosystems, ranging from forests to deserts.
The African landscape is diverse, ranging from lush rainforests to vast deserts.
words.defineEn: a large, dry area of land with very few plants, typically one covered with sand
words.defineVi: một vùng đất rộng lớn, khô ráo với rất ít thực vật, điển hình là một vùng phủ đầy cát
